content:
Congratulations on getting your Social Security card updated and your marriage certificate!

You're almost there with your driver's license update, and you're wondering if you can submit the temporary license to your student loan provider. In most cases, a temporary driver's license with your new name is acceptable as proof of identity for a name change.

You don't need to wait for the permanent license to arrive. You can go ahead and submit the temporary license, along with your updated Social Security card and marriage certificate, to your student loan provider.

When submitting the documents, make sure to:

1. Clearly indicate that the temporary license is a valid, government-issued ID with your new name.
2. Provide a copy of the temporary license, along with the other required documents (Social Security card and marriage certificate).
3. Check with your student loan provider if they have any specific requirements or guidelines for submitting temporary licenses.

Keep in mind that some providers might request additional documentation or have specific procedures for handling temporary licenses. If you're unsure, it's always best to confirm with their customer service department before submitting your documents.

Remember to keep a copy of all the documents you submit, and make sure to verify that your student loan provider has updated your account with your new name, Emily Joy Thompson, once they've processed your request.

You're doing great, and you're almost done with the name change process!
